reviewText: I have to disagree with the negative review(s) this movie has received.  While it's not a great sequal, by any standards, it is still funny, entertaining, and enjoyable.  I loved the other two La Cage films, and this  one is a close second.  The only really bad feature of the movie is the  atrocious dubbing.  I think it would play much better had it remained in  its original Italian language format, with subtitles.  (Though, I've never  seen a copy of it with subtitles -- If anyone knows where I can get one,  let me know.)  Michel Serrault's classic character is great fun, as always,  with his over-the-top effeminate persona.  Ugo Tognazzi is also at his  usual best, especially when he "plays it straight".  This is a  generally good and funny movie with undeserved bad reviews.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "La Cage Aux Folles III The Wedding" is the kind of sequel that offers little resemblance to the original "La Cage Aux Folles", or even "La Cage Aux Folles II" which came out in 1978 and 1981 respectively. Another somber point to consider is this. In 1986-87, thousands of people were dying from HIV/AIDS and there was little hope of treatment. In contrast, 1978-79, life was like a cocktail topped off with whimsy and innocence. Sadly, the young actor who played "Laurent" in the original "La Cage Aux Folles", Remi Laurent, died of AIDS on November 14th, 1989.Still, for the sake of actors Ugo Tognazzi and Michel Serrault, seeing them again is always a delight in spite of the obvious script limitations and poor dubbing.Keep in mind, "La Cage Aux Folles", (the series franchise) made everyone laugh and feel good about themselves; to take pride in who they are and to just enjoy life no matter what zany circumstances are thrown your way.I would like to enjoy life a little more with a DVD version of "La Cage Aux Folles III The Wedding". The film deserves that much since VHS is basically a medium from and of, the past. This person's perspective is simply this, the entire "La Cage Aux Folles" series will be enjoyed for generations to come..
summary: "La Cage Aux Folles III The Wedding", Another Perspective.

reviewText: If you are like me and feel that La Cage Aux Folles and its sequel are hillarious films, then do not see this. It is a complete disgrace and dishonor to the series. One of the principal screenwriters and creative mind behind the first 2 films, Francis Veber, is gone. And so is any charm, whimsy and any trace of comedy. This film is just flat out NOT FUNNY. Personally, I like Part 2 the best, with the original close behind. Ugo Tonazzi and Michel Serrault are on autopilot here and seem to be sleepwalking through their roles. The dubbing is atrocious and completely ruins an already lifeless film. The reason I think so many of us fell in love with the original was the complicated, sweet, and always humourous relationship between Albin and Renato. And also the dialogue was whip-smart and the situations, while often violent and serious, are always played with a layer of humor and human warmth. All fans should just consider the La Cage Aux Folles films a double set...NOT a trilogy.
summary: Horrible disgrace to the two classics...
Title: N/A
